page.title: 13Home Life for Southam People
page.content: Meals tend to reflect the lifestyle of the family. Many mothers work so foods chosen today are those which can be prepared and cleared away quickly. A typical menu would be: {Breakfast:}Cereal, toast, coffee or fruit juice. {Lunch:}Sandwiches, salad and cold meat with crisps and a drink. {Tea:}Chicken and chips, yoghurt and a cup of tea. Families are becoming conscious of healthy eating and cut down on fat and salt, eating more salad, vegetables and fruit. If local people can afford a meal out most pubs offer food and so do the two hotels in Southam. Foreign tastes can be met by the Kebab House and the Chinese take-away. A great favourite still is of course, good old fish and chips from the local chip shop.
